bibl.title: Letter from Bonnie Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, April 24, 1954

div1.p: Bonnie thanks Hench for all the work he did to get her husband, Albert E. Truby, awarded the Finlay Medal. She encloses a telegram and her response to the Cuban Ambassador.

div1.head: Letter from Bonnie Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, April 24, 1954
div1.opener:
Mrs ALBERT E. TRUBY
145 LAUREL STREET
SAN FRANCISCO 18, CALIFORNIA
April 24th 54 -
Dear Dr Hench:-
div1.p:
This telegram, a copy of which
I am enclosing, came yesterday and I hasten
to let you know how I have answered it.
A copy of my letter to the ambassador of Cuba
in Washington is also enclosed so you will
know how much we appreciate this award,
and how anxious I am that our daughter,
Mrs B. L. La Garde, should be present to re-
ceive it. Wasn't it a shame it came too late?
Albert was always looking forward so eagerly
to receiving it. However if you hadn't been
behind the project, he probably would never
have received any recognition, so I thank
you sincerely for all your effort on his behalf.

We are looking forward to seeing you in
June if you have the time to spare.

I received such a nice note from Robert Kean
in answer to my letter, after you so kindly informed
me of Mrs Kean's death, which I probably would
not otherwise have known.
